text: Kiss me, kiss me with your mouth again and again,1:2. Literally, “Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth.” The repetition of the word “kiss” forms a superlative, just as “song of songs” really means “the best song.” In addition the poem begins in the third person but then immediately switches to the second person. Such changes are smoothed out for less confusing reading. for your love is sweeter1:2. Literally, “better.” than wine.
